newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia's Suharto urges control of auto emission.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia's Suharto urges control of auto emission.

text.p: Indonesian President Suharto has called on state oil company Pertamina to increase production of unleaded gasoline to control automobile emissions, Environment Minister Sarwono Kusumaatmadja said on Tuesday.
"The president is very aware of the urgent need for air pollution control," he said after meeting Suharto. "Therefore the programme for controlling air pollution must be accelerated."
Sarwono said the president had ordered state departments to coordinate efforts with Pertamina to boost the use of gas and unleaded gasoline in automobiles.
"The development of using gas for automobiles is slow. The president wanted Pertamina to increase the (facilities)."
"The production of unleaded gasoline also must be increased, because it will contribute to the environment. The use of petrol with lead must be phased out soonest," the minister said.
He gave no time frame for the move.
Sarwono said Pertamina must make changes in its refineries to boost production of unleaded petrol, adding that the move could cost about $300 million.
Pertamina currently produces a small amount of unleaded petrol from its Balongan refinery in West Java.
